messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] My son is destroying my house right now
messages.msgSnippet: I have but its more money than I have right now and I don t think its necessary. I looked at your page on unschooling curriculum and realized something while I
messages.messageBody:
I have but its more money than I have right now and I don't think its necessary.

I looked at your page on unschooling curriculum and realized something while I was vacuming.
He just got finished with 5 long years of college. This took up a majority of his time when he wasnt at work. Now he is ready to jump back in and be the authority figure, Mr Command.

Now that he has more time to watch Courtney it looks like she isnt doing anything.

So I do have ideas and I'll prob blog about it a bit later. For now I have to get ready to go pick up Alyssa.


Nicole

Don't worry that children never listen to you : worry that they are always watching you--Robert Fulghum



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] My son is destroying my house right now
messages.msgSnippet: -=thanks ...sigh unfortunatlly I got a bomb dropped on me and got told by dh that we either have to start doing some curriculum or put her back in school. Ill
messages.messageBody:
-=thanks ...sigh unfortunatlly I got a bomb dropped on me and got
told by dh that we either have to start doing some curriculum or put
her back in school. Ill post more on it a bit later . -=-

Have you looked at clonlara.org? It's not better than plain old
unschooling, but it might be better than school! It can put a
structure on unschooling.

Sandra

http://findingthewonderful.blogspot.com/

That was nice to see. When I was a kid if I was sitting in a mess, I
was probably crying and my mom was probably yelling. It's nice to
see it in a different light.



I added your blog to the side of

http://thinkingsticks.blogspot.com

which is my strewing/connections blog

Sandra
